description: From legalized marijuana, to the widespread use of antidepressants and antianxiety medications, to
the ubiquitous presence of coffee shops, the "drug culture" affects nearly everyone in our
society.  This course introduces the world of psychopharmacology, with an emphasis on the basic
neural mechanisms underlying the effects of drugs, including their portrayal in popular movies and
music.  By learning how drugs can affect the way neurons communicate, students become more
thoughtful consumers.  Offered periodically during  January Term. Also counts toward neuroscience
and public health studies concentrations. Prerequisites: PSYCH 125 or PSYCH 238
or any Level I biology, chemistry, or chemistry/biology course.
